Pre-Game Insights: Lithuania have won all but one of their last four competitive matches, with their penalty-shootout defeat against Estonia in June’s Baltic Cup final being the exception.
Lithuania’s home advantage gives them a slight upper hand here and we are backing them to secure a narrow victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cyprus have lost their last nine competitive matches, conceding 33 goals and scoring just four since a 1-0 victory over Greece in September 2022.
Lithuania had failed to win any of their six matches in Group 1 of League C back in 2022, losing five and claiming one draw to finish rock-bottom in the standings.
Others: Lithuania and Cyprus go head-to-head in the 2024 UEFA Nations League at the Darius and Girėnas Stadium on Friday.
Temur Ketsbaia’s men claimed a 1-0 victory courtesy of a first-half strike from AIK forward Ioannis Pittas in their last friendly matchup.
